title: Leaves from the journal of our life in the Highlands, from 1848 to 1861.
author: Victoria
snippet: To the right we saw the Stormont and Strathtay.

title: Leaves from the journal of our life in the Highlands, from 1848 to 1861 :
author: Victoria
snippet: To the right wesaw the Stormont and Strathtay.

title: Tales of a Grandfather ... [ser. 1-3.] With notes
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: The Dukeof Gordon, the Marquis of Huntly, the Earls Seaforth, Errol, Nithsdale, Marischal, and Murray;Lords Stormont, Kilsythe, Drummond, Nairne,Belhaven, and Sinclair, besides many gentlemenof fortune and influence, w?re all confined in theTower, or other state prisons.

title: Tales of a Grandfather ... [ser. 1-3.] With notes
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: 2 " The ten who signed the Memorial were Lords Errol,Panmure, Stormont, and Kinnaird; Ogilvie of Bovnc, Morayof Abercairnie, N. Keith, for the Earl Marischall, CrummondofLogie, Fotheringham of Pourie, and Innes of Coxtoun."-Ibid., p.

title: Tales of a Grandfather ... [ser. 1-3.] With notes
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: The Earloi' Crawford and Lord David Lindsay, with themen of Fife and Angus, had the right wing ; LordRuthven commanded the left, with the people ofStrathearn and Stormont.
